qas.question: Which historian was referenced for the reports?

context: Sextus Julius Africanus further refers to the writings of <b7_0>historian<b7_0/> <a0_0>Thallus<a0_0/>: "This darkness Thallus, in the <b8_0>third<b8_0/> book of his History, calls, as appears to me without reason, <a1_0>an eclipse of the sun<a1_0/>. For the Hebrews celebrate the passover on <a2_0>the <b5_0>14<b5_0/>th day<a2_0/> according to the moon, and the passion of our Saviour falls on <a3_0><b9_0>the day before the passover<b9_0/><a3_0/>; but an eclipse of the sun takes place only when the moon comes under the sun." Christian apologist Tertullian believed the event was documented in <a4_0><b6_0>the Roman archives<b6_0/><a4_0/>.
